ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Central Auditory Dysfunction (Right Hemisphere Lesion)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Behavioral tests reveal a severe left ear deficit on dichotic digits and bilateral deficits on duration patterns, consistent with the radiologically confirmed right hemisphere lesion affecting Heschl's gyrus and the parietal lobe.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess central auditory function and interhemispheric transfer.
To assess temporal processing and central auditory integration.
To identify structural brain lesions associated with the seizure disorder.
Intra-operative monitoring to assess seizure activity and hemispheric function.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Pre-operative evaluation demonstrated normal peripheral hearing but significant central auditory deficits. Behavioral testing revealed a severe left ear deficit on dichotic digits, consistent with the right hemisphere lesion (Heschl's gyrus/parietal) identified on MRI/SPECT, and severe bilateral deficits on duration patterns. EEG monitoring confirmed bilateral abnormalities with greater activity in the right hemisphere.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Normal thresholds bilaterally from 250 to 8000 Hz.

tests.name: Dichotic Digits Test
tests.result_summary: Severe left ear deficit (~20%) and mild right ear deficit (~65%).

tests.name: Dichotic Rhyme Test
tests.result_summary: Borderline normal for the left ear and normal for the right ear.

tests.name: Radiologic Evaluation (SPECT and MRI)
tests.result_summary: SPECT showed asymmetrical accumulation in right basal ganglia and parietal region. MRI indicated a lesion in the area of Heschl's gyrus and inferior parietal region (right hemisphere).

tests.name: EEG
tests.result_summary: Frequent scattered bursts of polyspike and slow wave discharge bilaterally, with greater activity recorded from the right hemisphere.

tests.name: Competing Speech Test
tests.result_summary: Normal for right ear (~90%), severe deficit for left ear (~15%).

red_flags_present: Right hemisphere lesion (Heschl's gyrus and inferior parietal region)

escalation.rationale_short: Patient is scheduled for commissurotomy for intractable seizures.

follow_up_plan.objective: Reassessment of auditory function following commissurotomy (results presented in the next chapter).
